channel.title: Sending emails from anyone to anyone!
channel.description:
Spoofing Emails!
Ima try and make theis uber noob friendly So there will be no long explanations about smtp servers :o
This guide explains how to send anything from anyone to anyone [E-mail] :D
Open up command prompt To do this click on [URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img232.imageshack.us/img232/1395/start5bn.png[/img][/URL]
Then
[URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img85.imageshack.us/img85/9394/startrun4my.png[/img][/URL]
then type "cmd" in like the pic below
[URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img479.imageshack.us/img479/3346/run8gf.png[/img][/URL]
In the black box that appears on the screen type [code]telnet[/code] then we are going to connect to an smtp server to do this type: [code]o[/code] thats a o not a zero then [code]mail.hotmail.com 25[/code]
This is to connect to hotmails server The 25 on the end defines the port number, 25 being the default for most smtp mail servers. The subdomain will most likely be either mail., smtp., mx., mx1., or mx2.domain.com. For this example, lets use hotmail.com Telnet to 'mail.hotmail.com 25' and lets begin. The first thing it shows you is this: [code] Cant be arsed uploading another image LOL [/code] Ok, now you are connected to hotmail.com server type [code] ehlo [/code] after u see the reply with the shit [not important] type: [code] helo hotmail.com [/code] this lets the server know you are here... To start just send the email to someone with an email adress that has @hotmail.com at the end of their address because most of the time it dosent work to other servers.. [code]MAIL FROM: someone@hotmail.com[/code] obviously you replace the email and you'll probably get this as a return: [code]250 someone@hotmail.com Sender ok[/code] Now, enter this into the telnet box: [code]RCPT TO: someone@hotmail.com[/code] and if your going through the right domain, and entered it correctly, you should get this: [code]250 someone@hotmail.com Recipient ok [/code] now, its time to send your actual email type "data" then type your email At the end of your message just put a "." then enter button It will now say something like it in a queue Finished!! I wrote this tutorial a while ago. So if it don’t work or its out of date remember to tell me! Leave comments please...

item.title: Sending emails from anyone to anyone!
item.dc:creator: @OnlyOneRule OnlyOneRule
item.description:
@OnlyOneRule wrote:

Flamemanethedemonic:

Theere is a way easier way! You get on outlook, type in the email adress in the from box, then send to the peep! Or just make an email adress one letter off, and say its them ,and if they notice say my other account got booted!

um wtf are you on dude?

Read full topic

item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

Martin:

oh you need to keep typing or after a few mins it disconnects automatically, its a pain in the ass

…yes very…it disconnects after like 3 minutes for me…and i got to RCPT: or whatever and it says invalid command. oh well im sure it was intended to work and you put your best effort forth.

item.title: Sending emails from anyone to anyone!
item.dc:creator: @Martin Martin
item.description:
@Martin wrote:

Spoofing Emails!

Ima try and make theis uber noob friendly
So there will be no long explanations about smtp servers :o

This guide explains how to send anything from anyone to anyone [E-mail]

Open up command prompt
To do this click on

Then

then type “cmd” in like the pic below

In the black box that appears on the screen type

telnet

then we are going to connect to an smtp server to do this type:

o

thats a o not a zero
then

mail.hotmail.com 25

This is to connect to hotmails server
The 25 on the end defines the port number, 25 being the default for most smtp mail servers. The subdomain will most likely be either mail., smtp., mx., mx1., or mx2.domain.com. For this example, lets use hotmail.com Telnet to ‘mail.hotmail.com 25’ and lets begin. The first thing it shows you is this:

 Cant be arsed uploading another image LOL

Ok, now you are connected to hotmail.com server type

 ehlo

after u see the reply with the shit [not important]
type:

 helo hotmail.com

this lets the server know you are here…
To start just send the email to someone with an email adress that has @hotmail.com at the end of their address because most of the time it dosent work to other servers…

MAIL FROM: someone@hotmail.com

obviously you replace the email
and you’ll probably get this as a return:

250 someone@hotmail.com Sender ok

Now, enter this into the telnet box:

RCPT TO: someone@hotmail.com

and if your going through the right domain, and entered it correctly, you should get this:

250 someone@hotmail.com Recipient ok

now, its time to send your actual email
type “data”
then type your email
At the end of your message just put a “.” then enter button
It will now say something like it in a queue
Finished!!
I wrote this tutorial a while ago. So if it don’t work or its out of date remember to tell me!
Leave comments please…
